newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - ABN Amro says buys Lloyds TSB unit.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - ABN Amro says buys Lloyds TSB unit.

text.p: ABN Amro Australia Ltd said on Monday it had purchased Australian specialist licensed bank Lloyds Bank NZA from The National Bank of New Zealand Ltd for an undisclosed sum.
"I can confirm it (the purchase)," ABN spokeswoman Louise Keenan told Reuters.
The National Bank of New Zealand is a unit of U.K.-based Lloyds TSB Group Plc.

The purchase of Lloyds Bank NZA, which has assets of A$1.1 billion and provides corporate banking, treasury, finance and private banking services, would further strengthen ABN Amro's position in the Australian market, ABN Amro said in a statement.
"ABN Amro believes Lloyds NZA, and particularly its treasury and corporate loan portfolio, will add significantly to the further growth of its Australian activities," it said.
The National Bank of New Zealand was selling the unit to strenghten its focus on the New Zealand market, where it had strong retail and wholesale franchises, ABN Amro said.
The purchase was subject to Foreign Investment Review Board consent and other regulatory requirements, ABN Amro said
